diagnosis.score_summary: Medicube is suffering from a split personality between its clinical origins and its viral reality. While the visual and functional cores are consistent, the brand oscillates violently between being an exclusive 'Knowledge Club' on its site and a mass-market 'Safe Choice' on Amazon.

truth_1.headline: Professor vs. Magician
truth_1.gap_description: The WWW channels 'The Sage' (60%), relying on Dr. Shin and research data to convince a skeptic. The PDP channels 'The Magician' (60%), relying on the 'Miracle in a Jar' and viral transformation to hook a believer.
truth_1.evidence: WWW: 'Dr. Shin, Founder & Head of R&D' (Sage) vs. PDP: 'Miracle in a jar? ... TikTok viral' (Magician)
truth_1.why_matters: You are selling two different mechanisms of action: hard labor vs. magic. The customer who buys magic feels cheated when they receive homework; the customer who buys science doubts the product when they see magic tricks.
truth_1.the_hard_choice: You must decide the source of your authority. Option A: Scrub the 'Magic' and 'Viral' hype from Amazon to protect the scientific integrity of the brand. Option B: Lean into 'The Magician' globally, acknowledging that in the post-truth era, the feeling of transformation sells better than the molecular reality of it.

truth_2.headline: Club vs. Crowd
truth_2.gap_description: WWW positions the brand as 'The Knowledge Club'—a badge of distinction for the 'skintellectual' elite. PDP positions it as 'The Safe Choice'—a badge of conformity for the masses (#6 Best Seller).
truth_2.why_matters: A brand cannot be both a secret handshake and a public utility. By signaling exclusivity on your site and ubiquity on Amazon, you dilute the status of the direct customer while confusing the mass market buyer.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: You are currently straddling the fence between 'Niche Cool' and 'Mass Volume.' Option A: Restrict Amazon visibility to regain the 'Insider' status of a true skintellectual brand. Option B: Embrace the volume game, rewrite the website to welcome the 'Novice,' and accept that you are no longer a cult secret, but a household staple.

truth_3.headline: Cure vs. Makeup
truth_3.gap_description: WWW identifies as 'The Healer,' focused on correcting pathologies like 'uneven skin tone' and 'spots.' PDP identifies as 'The Empowerer,' focused on achieving an aesthetic 'Glass Glow' and 'Radiance.'
truth_3.evidence: Mission Vector: WWW 'Pathology Cure' (1/5) vs. PDP 'Enhancement' (4/5)
truth_3.why_matters: This is a conflict between medicine and cosmetics. If you sell a cure, users expect a treatment plan; if you sell a glow, they expect instant gratification. Mixing these expectations leads to disappointment on both ends.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: Is Medicube a clinic or a salon? Option A: Discipline the Amazon listing to focus strictly on 'Correction' and 'Repair,' limiting the audience to those with skin problems. Option B: Pivot the global brand to 'Aesthetic Enhancement,' demoting the medical language to the fine print and owning the 'Glow' as the primary promise.

truth_4.headline: The Bedside Manner Problem
truth_4.gap_description: Both channels score extremely low on Warmth (1-2/5) and Humor (1/5). The brand is consistent, but it is clinically cold.
truth_4.why_matters: A brand built entirely on 'Competence' has no emotional buffer. If the product fails or the science is questioned, there is no relationship to save you. You are a utility, not a friend.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: Your current efficiency is also your vulnerability. Option A: Maintain the 'Robotic' distance to preserve absolute authority, accepting that you will never be loved, only respected. Option B: Inject 'Caregiver' warmth into the voice to build emotional loyalty, even if it softens your hard scientific edge.

truth_5.headline: Gold Beats White
truth_5.gap_description: Both channels use 'Pharma-Code' visuals, but the PDP executes it with more commercial potency by aggressively using gold/amber accents to signal 'Vitamin C' efficacy. The WWW is sterile and passive by comparison.
truth_5.evidence: Visuals: PDP 'Clinical luxury... Vitamin C Gold' > WWW 'Pure white background'
truth_5.why_matters: The Amazon listing looks more expensive and potent than the direct site because it uses color to signal efficacy. The 'Sterile' look of the website may be signaling 'Generic' rather than 'Clinical.'
truth_5.the_hard_choice: The marketplace is out-designing the flagship. Option A: Strip the gold from Amazon to maintain the strict pharmaceutical purity of the brand code. Option B: Update the global visual identity to include the 'Potency Gold' found on the PDP, acknowledging that clinical signaling needs a touch of luxury to convert at a premium price.

marker_1.so_what: WWW treats a disease; PDP sells a dream. The brand is confused about whether it fixes problems or enhances beauty.

marker_2.so_what: Both channels agree on democratizing skin health, though PDP pushes the 'Everyday' accessibility slightly harder.

marker_3.so_what: Both channels are obsessed with data, but PDP is even more aggressive with 'Spec Sheet' transparency.

marker_4.so_what: WWW positions the product as an investment; PDP positions it as a utility. This creates a massive value perception gap.

marker_5.so_what: The personality is consistently expert-driven, though the PDP is colder and more authoritarian ('The Deity').

marker_6.so_what: The brand soul is split between The Sage (Truth) on WWW and The Magician (Transformation) on PDP.

marker_7.so_what: The voice is consistently dry, academic, and serious across both channels.

marker_8.so_what: Both channels strictly adhere to a clinical visual code, though PDP uses more gold accents.

marker_9.so_what: WWW hooks with the feature; PDP hooks with the molecule. WWW speaks to the user's problem; PDP speaks to the chemist.

marker_10.so_what: The story is consistently about faceless experts in a sterile lab.

marker_11.so_what: Both channels rely on dermatologists and stats, with PDP leaning slightly harder into raw graphs.

marker_12.so_what: The unique selling proposition is consistently the 'delivery technology' (capsules) rather than just the ingredient.

marker_13.so_what: Both channels function as educational platforms explaining the mechanism of action.

marker_14.so_what: Both channels promise to actively fix and perfect the skin's appearance.

marker_15.so_what: The emotional payoff is the confidence of being a savvy, capable consumer.

marker_16.so_what: WWW appeals to the rational pragmatist; PDP appeals to the trend-chaser. This splits the target audience identity.

marker_17.so_what: WWW offers distinction ('I know more'); PDP offers safety ('I do what everyone else does').
